intro: Urostigma fulvum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, while its stems are slender and often branched. Urostigma fulvum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value but can become invasive in certain environments.
